TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 921
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Emily M Perry, Unknown

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Emily M. Perry, January 26, 1833. Sending fruit trees.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 921

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Emily M. Perry, January 26, 1833. Sending fruit trees.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*I will send 200 or 300 peach trees by a wagon that is to leave here *date_mentioned n="01-30-1833">in four days.*/date_mentioned* Send up to *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned* after them and dont neglect them and get pomegranetes from *person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*and oranges attend to fruit at once and go to Work as tho. you expected to live there always. Save the live oaks round the yard and the Pecan trees—you dont say how [you] like the place*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mrs Emily M Perry*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Peach Point */location_mentioned* Care *person_mentioned*J. Austin.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
